payload.description:
Three new scrollytelling sections that extend the LCM story after the tool calls section.

A. Context Assembly — show the assembler building the model's actual message array: summaries filling a budget oldest-to-newest, then the fresh tail appended unconditionally.

B. Large File Handling — show a large file being extracted at ingestion, replaced with a compact stub, and retrieved later via lcm_describe.

C. Full Lifecycle / Forever Conversation — zoom out to a longer time horizon, show depth-2+ condensation, the DAG growing over weeks, the 'forever conversation' pitch.

Narrative order: A → B → C
payload.title: Scrollytelling: Context Assembly, Large Files, Full Lifecycle

payload.description:
Add a new scrollytelling section after the current tool-call steps that shows how the assembler builds the model's message array before each turn.

Story beats:
1. Transition: 'But how do summaries actually reach the model?'
2. Show the assembler constructing the context array: evictable prefix (summaries filling a token budget oldest-to-newest) + protected fresh tail (raw messages always appended unconditionally)
3. Visualize the budget bar filling — summary tokens vs fresh tail tokens locked on the other end
4. Key insight: the model never sees raw past messages, only summary tokens — but the fresh tail is always verbatim
5. When summaries overflow the budget, oldest summaries are dropped from context (but remain in the DAG, still accessible via expand_query)

Visuals needed:
- Assembler sequence animation — items populating the model's message array in order
- Budget split: summary portion fills left-to-right, fresh tail portion anchored on right
- Reuses existing ContextPanel, message/summary item primitives

Source: architecture.md 'Context assembly' section
payload.title: Section A: Context Assembly scrollytelling

payload.description:
Add a scrollytelling section showing LCM's large file extraction and retrieval story.

Story beats:
1. User pastes a large file (log, codebase, etc.) into the conversation
2. At ingestion, LCM detects it exceeds the largeFileTokenThreshold (25k tokens)
3. Animation: the file block shrinks/extracts — content stored externally, replaced with a compact reference stub in the message
4. Conversation continues normally; the stub is tiny
5. Later, the agent needs the file — calls lcm_describe(id: 'file_xxx')
6. Full file content returned; agent has what it needs without having consumed context budget

Visuals needed:
- File block component (new) — large, then animates to stub reference card
- Storage indicator (file stored externally)
- lcm_describe retrieval showing file metadata + content

Source: architecture.md 'Large file handling' section
payload.title: Section B: Large File Handling scrollytelling

payload.description:
Add a scrollytelling section that zooms out to a long time horizon, showing the DAG growing through depth-2+ condensation and framing LCM as infrastructure for forever conversations.

Story beats:
1. Time lapse: conversation spans weeks, many more turns
2. DAG grows: depth-0 leaves accumulate, first depth-1 condensation fires, then enough depth-1 nodes to trigger depth-2 condensation
3. Show depth-2 node forming — more abstract, more durable, covering weeks of arc
4. Fresh tail always present; the model can reach any historical detail via expand_query
5. Closing image: a deep DAG (d0, d1, d2) representing months of work — one conversation, never truncated

Visuals needed:
- Extend DagPanel to support depth-2 (and optionally depth-3) nodes
- Time labels on the DAG (Week 1, Week 2, etc.)
- Depth-2 condensation animation (mirrors existing depth-1 condensation but one level up)

Dependencies: Section A and B should be done first (narrative order)
